results.title: Germany year zero = Allemagne, annee zero
results.brief_description: Edmund, a boy of fifteen, lives with his family in the desolation of post-war Berlin, influenced by a Nazi teacher. After being convinced that only the strong should survive he perpetrates a crime in the belief that he is performing an heroic act. The final sequence of Edmund wandering amongst the ruins of devastated Berlin is one of the finest things the cinema has to offer. Photography by Robert Juillard.

results.title: Georgy girl
results.creator_credit: Everglades Productions, Robert A. Goldston, Otto Plaschkes and Silvio Narizzano
results.brief_description: A quintiessential “swinging 60’s” comedy, starring Lynn Redgrave in the title role of Georgy. Gauche and out of place in her flatmate Meredith’s sexually liberated world, Georgy longs for a traditional romance with a husband and children. Meredith, (Charlotte Rampling), lives for the moment and the next man. Currently that man is Jos played by Alan Bates. When Meredith becomes pregnant, it is Georgy who becomes maternal, and the object of not only Jos’s affection, but that of a lascivious wealthy widower played by James Mason. Ultimately, Georgy gets all that she desires. Lynn Redgrave touchingly conveys Georgy’s warmth and naivety, while Rampling gives an excellent performance as the moody and insensitive Meredith. This is an effervescent film, well known for the title song performed by The Seekers.

results.title: Georgia
results.creator_credit: Georgia Film Corporation, CiBy 2000, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Barbara Turner and Ulu Grosbard
results.brief_description: Sadie is an ambitious singer of limited talent, whose dependence on alcohol and drugs wreaks havoc within her life and on her interpersonal relationships, particularly with her sister, Georgia, whose happy marriage and thriving music career, principally in country and western, contrasts with Sadie’s incessant struggle. Ulu Grosbard’s film (originally slated to be directed by Robert Altman) is a raw and affecting portrait of a woman, whose ambition and lust for life is compromised by addictions and a self destructive nature, compounded by living in the shadow of her urbane and successful sister. The contrast between the sisters is constantly driven home by the inter-cutting of their parallel lives - Georgia is well dressed, orderly, mannered, emotionally controlled, living in a pristine country home, in a safe, assured, if passionless, existence; Sadie is slovenly, emotional, irrational, psychologically raw and barren, drifting between filthy abodes and unsavoury friends. A powerful examination of sibling dynamics, “Georgia” is challenging in its brutal evocation of the destructive impulses and unfortunate circumstances that underscore life’s many inequities. Mare Winnginham was nominated for Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her performance in the title role.

results.title: George of the jungle
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Mandeville Films, David Hoberman, Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet and Sam Weisman
results.brief_description: Based on the cartoon series, “George of the jungle” is an action/comedy version of the characters created by Jay Ward. George (Brendan Fraser) is lost to the jungle as a young boy and is subsequently raised by apes and other jungle creatures. As George grows to manhood it transpires that he is a brave but none too bright young man. An intrepid American woman, Ursula Stanhope, travels to the jungle to satisfy her longing for adventurous experiences. Stanhope’s snobbish boorish fiancee follows her to the jungle and becomes embroiled in a tug-of-war with George for Stanhopes’ affection. But can George leave his gentle animal family for the urban jungle of San Francisco? The comedy is broad and slapstick in style, with Fraser revelling in the pratfalls of the lead role. Also featuring the voice of John Cleese (as Ape the ape) and 1970s blaxploitation icon Richard Roundtree.

results.title: Gentlemen prefer blondes
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Sol Siegel and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Two showgirls go to Paris in search of rich husbands in this musical comedy which is memorable for the score and songs such as “Diamonds are a girl’s best friend”. Starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russell and Charles Coburn. Based on the novel by Anita Loos.

results.title: Gentleman's agreement [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Phil Green (Gregory Peck) is a single father and journalist lured to New York as a feature writer for a magazine. Assigned to write about anti-semitism, he struggles to find the right angle from which to explore this issue from a more personal perspective. Unrelenting in his quest for truth, Phil poses as a Jew and encounters prejudice first hand. Determined to expose intolerance and hypocrisy, he confronts those who blatantly practice anti-semitism and challenges those close to him who support it by remaining silent. Includes original theatrical trailer and Movietone News footage. Cast also includes Dorothy McGuire, John Garfield, Celeste Holm, Anne Revere, June Havoc and Dean Stockwell. Screenplay by Moss Hart, based on the original story by Laura Z. Hobson. Cinematography by Arthur Miller. Music by Alfred Newman. (Academy Awards: Best Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actress)

results.title: Gendernauts
results.brief_description: Gendernauts explores avant-garde concepts of gender fluidity amongst a diverse group of people in the San Francisco bay area, focusing on the ways these “gender cyborgs” have transgressed conventional perceptions through altering their minds and bodies with hormone and surgical treatments. Underground documentary maker Monika Treut boldly leads the viewer into a brave new world where biological women use testosterone to achieve maleness, where men have surgery to become women, and where some men and women are content to exist on the boundaries of gender as intersexuals. Media and gender theorist Sandy Stone provides a thought-provoking commentary as Treut deconstructs assumptions about gender by delving into the life experiences of sex artist Annie Sprinkle, author and transgender theorist Susan Stryker, video artist Texas Tomboy, author Max Wolf Valerio, photographer Stafford, net artist Jordy Jones, former centrefold model Tornado, and self-confessed intersexual Hida Vilario. Juxtaposed with footage from inside drag king bar Club Confidential, and the transgender-friendly Tom Waddell Clinic, these subjects openly discuss their backgrounds, sexuality and fascination with gender bending, revealing just how constrictive traditional observations about the dual nature of gender have been. Excerpts from films such as Annie Sprinkle’s Linda, Les, and Annie (1990), Texas Tomboy’s Alienator (1997), Monika Treut’s Max (1992), Jordy Jones’ Injectible Man (1998), and Shu Lea Cheang’s web feature Brandon (1998) are also interspersed with the interview footage. This documentary had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival Panorama in February 1999.

results.title: Gattaca [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jersey Films, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Andrew Niccol
results.brief_description: Niccol’s debut as a director, a year before he wrote the script for ‘The Truman Show’, is set in a near-future where the lives of the majority of citizens are determined before birth through genetic engineering of their genes, and the ‘natural-born’ minority of ‘In-Valids’ is shunned. Vincent Freeman (Ethan Hawke) is one of the latter, who, in order to pursue his goal of travelling into space, assumes the identity of a member of the genetic elite (Jude Law). His cover is threatened when he becomes a suspect in a murder investigation. With a relentless investigator in pursuit and the colleague he has fallen in love with beginning to suspect his deception, his dreams begin to unravel. Cast includes Uma Thurman, Ethan Hawke, Alan Arkin, Jude Law and Ernest Borgnine.

results.title: Gas, food lodging
results.creator_credit: Cineville, Seth Willenson, William Ewart, Daniel Hassid and Alison Anders
results.brief_description: Set in Laramie, New Mexico, this film deals with the relationship between a single mother and her two teenage daughters, complicated by small town isolation. The film explores the notion of family as it tackles issues of love, death, sex and escape. Stars Brooke Adams, Ione Skye and Fairuza Balk in the lead roles. Cast also includes James Brolin, Robert Knepper, David Landsbury, Chris Mulkey and Donovan Leitch. Screenplay by Alison Anders, based on the novel ‘Don’t Look and It Won’t Hurt’ by Richard Peck. Edited by Tracy S. Granger. Photographed by Dean Lent. Music composed by J. Mascis.

results.title: Gardens of stone
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Michael I. Levy and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: There’s the war-toughened sergeant who passionately longs to train soldiers for fighting in Vietnam, but is assigned to the elite Old Guard. His beautiful girlfriend, a Washington Post reporter who is fervently against the war. The zealous soldier that the sergeant takes under his wing, and the young woman who learns the pain of being an army wife. Their stories are poignantly told in Francis Coppola’s perceptive and moving film that stars James Caan, Angelica Huston, James Earl Jones and Mary Stuart Masterson. This film takes a different look at the Vietnam war era in the United States. It is a drama that captures the anguishing effect of the war on the relationships of the men and women at home. Based on the novel by Nicholas Proffitt. Original music by Carmine Coppola.
